result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:23 AM Defendant Niles J Mckee in court.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez for Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Niles J Mckee.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called to review the doctors report.
Both counsel have received and reviewed the report.  
No objections by either counsel.
Court adopts the findings of the report and finds the defendant competent to proceed.
Defense requests a further proceedings in about 30 - 45 days.
Cover sheet for Confidential Records with attached report, evaluation conducted by Dr. Goebel and filed by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.

Case called for jury status hearing.

Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
